sentences.english: At twenty-two I am utterly worn out and finished.
sentences.chinese: 二十二歲，我已經絕對是一撅不振，完蛋了。

sentences.english: You and I are both due to step off if we're not able to complete the task.
sentences.chinese: 如果你我不能完成這次任務，咱們倆都得完蛋。

sentences.english: This should be the end of Drouet, and don't you forget it.
sentences.chinese: 這下杜洛埃就要完蛋了，你別忘了這一點。

sentences.english: I think, this pronouncing all of a sudden is to doom, repeatedly have not luckily cause.
sentences.chinese: 我想着，這一下肯定是完蛋了，再無幸理。

sentences.english: If she expects floral delights and you fail to satisfy, you’re screwed.
sentences.chinese: 如果她想得到鮮花而你並沒有滿足她，你就完蛋了。

sentences.english: If they come here we'll cook their goose, the Pope and Cardinal Wisman.
sentences.chinese: 要來我們就讓他們完蛋，羅馬教皇和主教魏斯曼。

sentences.english: If the teacher finds out, we're goners .
sentences.chinese: 如果被老師發現，我們就完蛋了。

sentences.english: Anyone on the list, its protagonist warns, is “dead meat”.
sentences.chinese: 名單上的任何人，它的主角警告說，都會很快完蛋。

sentences.english: One good blow would topple him over and down and out.
sentences.chinese: 只要好好的一拳，就能把他打倒，叫他完蛋。

sentences.english: Everybody congratulates you, but nobody knows how many times you were fucked.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都祝賀你，但誰也不知道多少次你都完蛋了。

sentences.english: The scheme for building an airport seems to be completely defunct now.
sentences.chinese: 建造新機場的計劃看來整個完蛋了。

sentences.english: A woman is incomplete until she is married. Then she is finished.
sentences.chinese: 女人要到結婚時纔算完整，結婚後便完蛋了。

sentences.english: I have only to cry out, and people will come, and then slap, bang!
sentences.chinese: 我只要喊一聲，人家就會來，全完蛋。

sentences.english: With the battlle of Waterloo， Napoleon‘s rule in Europe was ended.
sentences.chinese: 滑鐵盧一戰，拿破崙對歐洲的統治就完蛋了。

sentences.english: In fact, many Whigs themselves hoped their party had been destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，許多輝格黨人自己也希望他們的黨完蛋。

sentences.english: When he found his current job, his family dubbed him lost forever.
sentences.chinese: 找到現在這份工作時，全家人都稱他是徹底完蛋了。

definition: to have bad luck/to be out of luck
cannot maintain (sth)/unable to keep/more likely than not/may well
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
to run away/to take to one's heels
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4
